about.title: About Me
description: Hey! I'm a gameplay programmer with over two years of experience. I focus on building solid and flexible architecture, with a strong interest in AI behaviors, gameplay systems, and complex mechanics.

I've always been drawn to games that reward curiosity and skill, and I try to bring that same mindset into my work. For me, programming isn't just about making things function, it's about helping the player feel something through how the game responds.

blocks.title: Projects
blocks.text: AR/VR multiplayer platformer developed for Oculus, awarded the Lion at the Biennale di Venezia (2022).

blocks.title: Key Contributions
items: Designed and implemented an enemy AI system using a finite state machine combined with behavior trees, supporting coordinated enemy interactions and multiple states such as idle, chase, and attack.
Built core player mechanics including wall-climbing parkour and a combo-based combat system with input-driven attacks, mid-air moves, and chained abilities.
Worked on an authoritative server multiplayer model, ensuring player interactions such as attacks, item pickup, and item throwing felt responsive and consistent despite network latency.
Developed gameplay systems specifically for VR, working hands-on with Oculus headsets and integrating input and interaction using the XR Toolkit.

blocks.title: About the Game
blocks.text: A fast-paced first-person action game centered on momentum and precision.

blocks.title: My Role
blocks.text: As Lead Programmer, I developed the core movement, dash, and attack systems, as well as the additive level-loading architecture, focusing on scalability, performance, and clean modular code in Unity.
